episode_title: 719 - The One With Ross and Monica’s Cousin

content.description: Central Perk, Monica and Phoebe are on the couch as Joey enters.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh hey! How was your audition?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m sorry, do I know you?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What are you doing?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Nothing, I’m just practicing blowing you off because I’m gonna be a big movie star!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh! You got it?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well no, not yet. But the audition went really good.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What was it for?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, it’s this big budget period movie about these three Italian brothers who come to America around the turn of the century. It’s really classy! Oh, and the director is supposed to be the next next Martin Scorcese.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: The next next?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, there’s this guy from Chicago who’s supposed to be the next Martin Scorcese, all right? But then this guy’s right after him. (Joey’s cell phone rings and he answers it.) Hello!

content.speaker: Estelle
content.text: Joey! It’s Estelle! I just talked to the casting people: they loved you!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: They loved me!

content.speaker: Estelle
content.text: Yeah, they wanna see you again tomorrow.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh my God!

content.speaker: Estelle
content.text: There’s just one thing. Do you have a problem with full frontal nudity?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Are you kidding me? I never rent a movie without it! (Listens) Oh. (Listens) Uh, okay uh let me call you back. (Hangs up.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What’s the matter?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: They want me to be totally naked in the movie!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wow!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I know! My grandmother’s gonna see this!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Grandma’s gonna have to get in line.

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, (although its really just Monica’s now with Matthew Perry in rehab) Monica is folding her laundry with Ross reading the paper and Phoebe standing in the kitchen.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey, the wedding is so close! Are you getting nervous?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah. But a part of me also can’t wait ‘til it’s over. Chandler and I have this pact not to have sex again until the wedding.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: A no sex pact huh? I actually have one of those going on with every woman in America.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey Phoebe, will you give me a hand?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Sure.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I gotta make up the guest bedroom. (To Ross) Hey, Cousin Cassie is coming to stay with us for a few days.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Cassie?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Uh-hmm.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wow, I haven’t seen her for, like, forever. I wonder if she still carries that Barbie everywhere she goes.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ross, she’s 25 years old.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So what! I still have—No you’re probably right.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey Pheebs, can I talk to you over here for a second?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Subtle guys!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know you’re planning my surprise bridal shower.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well okay—Well don’t ruin it! Just play along at least!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay. Sorry. (She goes into the guest bedroom.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God! We have to throw her a shower?!

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Joey is entering.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey! What did you decide to do about the movie?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t know! It’s not like it’s porn! This is a serious, legitimate movie. Y’know? And the nudity is really important to the story.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s what you say about porn.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You’re right. Maybe I shouldn’t even go on the call back.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No! No you should! A lot of major actors do nude scenes! I mean, the chance to star in a movie? Come on!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well that’s true. And I am only naked in one scene. Plus it sounds really great. My character’s catholic and he falls in love with this Jewish girl. Who run away together and they get caught in this big rainstorm. So we go into this barn and undress each other and hold each other. It’s really sweet and-and tender.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Plus, everyone’s gonna see your thing. (Giggles.)

content.description: Phoebe’s apartment, Phoebe and Rachel are trying to plan Monica’s shower.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, when can we have this shower?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: She has got so much going on we-we have only two options. We have Friday…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well that’s only two days away. What is the other option?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yesterday!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well if we make it yesterday, woo-hoo! We’re done!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God, Phoebe, this is impossible! We can’t do this by Friday! We have to find a place. We have to invite people! We have to get food! There’s just too much to do! It’s impossible! We can’t do it! We cannot do it! We cannot do it!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Rachel, calm down!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. I’m sorry. You’re right, you’re right.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Just calm down woman!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Phoebe, I already, I already did.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh okay. All right, then I need to calm down a little.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. Okay. (They sit down.) I think we can do this if we just get organized. All right? We have two days to plan this party. We just need to make fast decisions! Okay? All right, where are we gonna have it?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Uh, here. What time?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: 4 o’clock. Food?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Finger sandwiches and tea.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ooh great! Very Monica.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: And chili!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ah you went one too far. Uh, flowers or balloons?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Both!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: We’re paying for this y’know.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Neither.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. Umm, what should we do for the theme?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Lusts of the flesh.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I don’t know. (Timidly) A cowboy theme?

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Monica is on the couch writing when Chandler enters to make his brief cameo.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know I’m-I’m really glad we decided not to sleep together before the wedding.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh boy, me too!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know I was thinking if we had a…a big fight and uh we broke up for a few hours…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Technically we could have sex again. What do you think, bossy and domineering?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: The wedding is off, sloppy and immature!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s me! Come on!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay. (They both jump up to head for their room, but Monica stops.) But wait, we can’t. My Cousin Cassie is in the guest room, we’re supposed to have lunch.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, get rid of her, obsessive and shrill.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Shrill?! The wedding is back on!

(Cassie enters from the guest room, with her hair up. The extremely beautiful and sexy Denise Richards is playing Cassie. Woo hoo! For those of you who don’t know who she is, rent Wild Things and she was also the last Bond girl in The World Is Not Enough.)

content.speaker: Cassie
content.text: I thought I heard voices. You must be Chandler.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hi! Nice to meet you!

content.speaker: Cassie
content.text: Nice to meet you too.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So, are you ready to go?

content.speaker: Cassie
content.text: Yeah.

(She lets her hair down and whips her hair around in Baywatch-esque slow motion with a Barry White song in the background. Chandler needless to say can’t help but stare along with the rest of the male and lesbian population of North America.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chandler!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’ll be right with you.

content.description: Central Perk, Ross is there as Chandler and Monica enters.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Cassie needs to stay at your place.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What—why?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Because Purvy Perverson over here can’t stop staring at her.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?! Chandler, she’s our cousin!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I was not staring at her. Okay? I was just listening intently. It’s called being a good conversationalist. Watch. (Stares at Monica’s eyes.) Say something.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You were staring about eight inches south of there.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Fine, she can stay at my place. By the way, what-what does Cassie even look like now.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: She looks exactly like Aunt Marilyn.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Umm, so this Aunt Marilyn is-is-is-is she coming to the wedding?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wafer thin ice!

content.description: A Casting Director’s Office, Joey is entering for his callback.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, I’m back!

content.speaker: The Casting Director
content.text: Hi-hi Joey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh so, will-will I be reading the same scene again?

content.speaker: The Casting Director
content.text: Actually, I tried to call you. You didn’t need to come down here today.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh great! Y’know I would’ve been perfect for this part, but whatever! Y’know, thanks for making a bad decision and ruining your movie! Good day! (Starts to leave.)

content.speaker: The Casting Director
content.text: Wait Joey! You didn’t need to come down because the director saw your tape from yesterday and loved it.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: And scene! Huh? Wasn’t that fun? We did a little improv there. Yeah! Okay! So you-you-you-you were saying?

content.speaker: The Casting Director
content.text: Well, the director thinks you’re really right for the part and wants to meet you tomorrow.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wow! Sure! That’s great!

content.speaker: The Casting Director
content.text: Oh, and your agent said you were okay with the nudity.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah! Yeah sure, just so long as it’s handled tastefully and that barn is not too cold.

content.speaker: The Casting Director
content.text: Terrific! Well uh, there’s one more thing. Uhh, uh it’s really important to the director that everything in this movie is authentic. Yeah, and so in your love scene with Sarah she talks about how she’s never seen a naked man who wasn’t Jewish. So… (Laughs.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So…What?

content.speaker: The Casting Director
content.text: So uh well, the director is insisting that whoever play that part be authentically, anatomically not Jewish. Do you know what I’m saying?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yes!

content.speaker: The Casting Director
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No. What?

content.speaker: The Casting Director
content.text: An Italian Catholic immigrant at this time would not be…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Barmitsvahed?
(The casting director shakes her head.)

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Joey is telling Monica what the casting director was trying to get to.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So to get this part you can’t be?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Nope.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: But you are?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yep.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: But you told them you weren’t?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s right.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wow! Wow! And it’s definitely all gone? There’s nothing there to work with? (Joey glares at her.) What were you thinking?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t know! I really want this part! And they tell you no matter what you get asked at an audition you say yes. Like if-if they want you to ride a horse, you tell ‘em you can! And just figure out how to do it later.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Joey! This is not like learning to ride a horse! This is like learning to…grow a turtleneck!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I kn-I know! I know! Okay? And apparently tomorrow when I go in to meet the director I have to take off my clothes so that they can see what my body looks like.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God, what are you gonna do?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I just have to call my agent and tell her I can’t do the part. (Gets up for the phone.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Unless!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Unless what?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, this may sound crazy, but there maybe something we could fashion.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Like what?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well I’m not sure yet, but umm, off the top of my head I’m thinking double sided tape and some sort of luncheon meat.

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s, Phoebe is entering and Rachel is still planning.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey! I’ve got a great idea for party favors for the shower. Okay, we get some uh mahogany boxes and carve everyone’s names in them and inside is everyone’s individual birth stone.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. Okay. All right, you take care of that. And meanwhile, the party is tomorrow and we still don’t have a guest list.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay. Okay! Well okay, who do we know that’s coming? Me. Are you?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey! What’s up Mon?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well uh, I’m trying to make something for Joey. Do you mind if I raid your fridge?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Have at it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay. (Opens the fridge.) All right, turkey. Eh, that won’t work. Cheese? (Picks it up) That won’t work. Olive loaf? (Picks it up) I hope that won’t work.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Are you makin’ him a sandwich?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No it’s umm, more like a wrap. Okay so uh, I’m gonna go guys.

content.speaker: Phoebe and Rachel
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I guess you can get back to deciding on what to get me for a present! (Runs out.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: We have to get her a present?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay but look! Look at what I got! It’s her address book! (Holds it up.) We have a guest list!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God you’re amazing! Did you just pull that out of her purse?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Uh-huh, and a little seed money for the party. (Holds up $40.)

content.description: Ross’s apartment, there is a knock on the door and Ross opens it to Cassie.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Cassie?!

content.speaker: Cassie
content.text: Hey Ross!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Cassie
content.text: It’s been so long! Last time I saw you, you were setting up your tent in line to see Return of the Jedi .

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh. Oh, that’s right. So-so you did see me that day, because it seemed like you didn’t.

content.speaker: Cassie
content.text: Ah yeah, sorry about that.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It’s okay. Come, come on in.

content.speaker: Cassie
content.text: Thanks for letting me stay here! I mean Monica’s place was nice, but her fianc�e sure stares a lot.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh.

(She sets down her bag and we travel back to slow motion world. She once again whips her hair around in slow motion with the love doctor Barry White singing in the background. And I’d also like to take this opportunity to mention that she can also be seen in Starship Troopers and that she was born in Downers Grove, Illinois which just happens to be a few miles from where I live. Anyway, Cousin Ross is now staring.)

content.speaker: Cassie
content.text: Oh my God! You do a great Chandler!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh-huh. Yeah, I-I have a knack for impressions.

content.speaker: Cassie
content.text: Well, maybe after we get reacquainted uh, you can do me.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah—No!!

content.description: Ross’s apartment, Cassie is eating dinner and Ross is pacing behind her because of what she’s eating.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Cassie, how you-how you doin’ on that…hot dog.

content.speaker: Cassie
content.text: I’m all done.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Thank God.

content.speaker: Cassie
content.text: I guess the last time we really hung out was when our parents rented that beach house together.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh right. Right. Ooh, remember the time I uh, I pinned you down and tickled you ‘til you cried? (She laughs) We’re probably too old to do that now.

content.speaker: Cassie
content.text: I’ll always remember that summer, because it’s when I got all of these freckles. (She pulls her blouse open to show him her shoulder and bra strap.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh-huh! Uh-huh! And-and-and I’ll always remember that summer because that’s when I realized that we are related.

content.speaker: Cassie
content.text: It took you that long to figure it out, huh?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well I’m, I’m a little slow. (To himself) Just as our children would be.

content.description: Phoebe’s apartment, it’s Monica’s bridal shower and Phoebe is passing out some finger food.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: How are you? (The woman nods) Good. (She goes over to another couple of women.) Hi, thanks for coming.

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: Oh thank you.
(The other woman declines.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Thank you. (To the other woman) No? (She nods.) All right. (She goes to another pairing.) Oh, it’s so nice to see you.

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: No.

content.speaker: The Other Woman
content.text: No thanks.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay. (Goes over to Rachel.) Hey Rach?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Who the hell are all these people?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, I don’t know. I called all the people in Monica’s phone book and these are the only ones who could show up on 24 hours notice.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hmm, y’know there’s another word for people like that: Losers!
(A woman approaches.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi! I’m Rachel. This is Phoebe. I’m the maid of honor. How do you know Monica?

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: I was her accountant four years ago.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohhhh!

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: I’m very interested to find out who’s been doing her taxes these last four years.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That’s great!

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: So, what time is Monica supposed to get here?

content.speaker: Phoebe and Rachel
content.text: I don’t know.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Excuse us for a minute. (They go into the kitchen.) You didn’t tell her to come?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You were supposed to tell her!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No I wasn’t! You were supposed to tell her to come, and I was supposed to bring the cake!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Fine, I’ll go call her.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes! And please tell her to bring a cake!

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s, Joey is standing at the counter as Monica enters carrying a tray.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, we have a lot of options here, a number of prototypes for you to try on.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wow! This looks great!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah! Okay, this one is a mushroom cap. (Points to it.) Umm, this one is made of bologna. (Points.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: And-and-and-and-and the toothpicks?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, just until the glue dries.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Thank God!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Now, these are-are more realistic, but perishable.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ah.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay? (To a different group) Over here we have pink suede, which is nice. But umm, if it gets wet then you know it’s gonna shrink.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well maybe we just take that one away. (Picks it up and throws it away.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I also, did a little something in fur. But umm, that’s really just for me. (Rubs it against her cheek.) Okay. So, why don’t you go into your room and try these on and we’ll see—get a better idea of what’s gonna work.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Thanks, you are such a good friend. And this is so weird.
(He goes into his room to try them on and closes the door.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ow!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Toothpick?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What are you trying on now?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: The fruit roll up.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: And?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Delicious.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Joey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wait a minute! Wait a minute! We have a winner!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?! Which one?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: The Silly Putty ! It’s not so silly anymore!
(They hug.)

content.description: Ross’s apartment, Cassie and Ross are watching a movie and Cassie is pouring Ross some more wine, as Ross has his hands full with the glass and holding the bowl of popcorn in his lap.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: She’s your cousin. She’s your cousin! If she knew what was going on in your head she’d think you were sick ! (She grabs some popcorn.) Or would she? Let’s back up a second. She was the one who suggested opening a bottle of wine. She was the one who turned down the lights. She was the one that wanted to rent Logan’s Run , the sexiest movie ever. (She grabs the blanket from behind him and looks at him.) Oh, I know that look. Forget it. I want it. She wants it. I’m going in.
(They exchange looks, smile, and shrug their shoulders before Ross suddenly lunges forward in an attempt to kiss her, but she expertly backs away.)

content.speaker: Cassie
content.text: Hey! What the hell are you doing?! (They sit back up.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Say something clever! (Pause.) Okay, doesn’t have to be clever, it just has to be words. Say some words. (Pause) Any words will do. (Pause) Oh my God! This is the longest that anyone has not talked ever! (Pause) There is nothing you can say to make this worse!! So just say something!! (Pause.) (To her) I-I, I uh haven’t had sex in a very long time. (She leaves.) (In his head) Yeah, you really shouldn’t have said anything.

content.description: outside Phoebe’s apartment, Monica is knocking on the door.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe! Rachel! It’s Monica! I wonder what you could possibly need me for on such short notice! (She bursts into the apartment to find only Phoebe and Rachel sitting on the couch.) Oh.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh Monica, we are so sorry.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: For what?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well first, for forgetting to throw you a bridal shower.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: And then for forgetting to invite you to it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You al-you already had it?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah. Well, we called everyone in your phone book and a bunch of people came, but it took us so long to get you here that they-they had to leave.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, we wanted to throw you a big surprise and a great shower, and now you don’t have either.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: We ruined everything.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ugh…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well no, wait a minute, that’s not true! No, what did, that was really sweet. And it kinda works out for the best.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What do you, what do you mean?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well now, I get to spend my shower with the only people I really love! I mean, I get all those presents (Motions to the pile in the corner) without having to talk to people I don’t even like!
(Suddenly, everyone stands up and comes out of hiding. All of them are glaring at Monica.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Surprise…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Sur-surprise.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: …Monica.

content.description: The casting director’s office, Joey is there to show off to the director, so to speak.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: And what’s cool is, the character is from Naples, right?

content.speaker: The Director
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: My whole family’s from Naples!

content.speaker: The Director
content.text: Oh that’s great! Okay, well I’ve heard everything I need to hear. I just need to uh, Leslie…

content.speaker: The Casting Director
content.text: Joey, this is the awkward part.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh! Hey right! Not a problem. (He starts taking off his clothes.) I totally understand. You need to y’know make sure I don’t have any horrible scars or tattoos. Don’t you worry; I have nothing to hide. (He drops his pants and stands, back up and looks down.) So there you go, that’s me. (We cut to a camera angle looking at the casting director and movie director through Joey’s legs.) One hundred percent natural! (Suddenly, there’s a thud as something falls off.) (Everyone is shocked.) I tell ya, that has never happened before.

content.description: Phoebe’s apartment, Phoebe is getting out linens for Cassie who is in the bathroom.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Cassie, are you finding everything okay in there?

content.speaker: Cassie
content.text: Yeah! Thank you so much for letting me stay here.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh! No problem! I… (Cassie emerges from the bathroom and we once again visit slow motion Barry White background music land with the sexy hair-flipping thing going on, only this time Phoebe is entranced. For more information on Denise Richards you can visit your local library or look her up on the Internet at her official website at www.deniserichards.com.)

content.speaker: Cassie
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Say something! Say anything! Ask her out! She’s not your cousin!
